issues.description: The Milkable interface in the solution repository defines the method messageOnMilk with a parameter (double volume), whereas the problem statement specifies it without any parameters, potentially confusing students about the required method signature and leading them to implement an incorrect interface based on the solution reference.
issues.suggested_fix: Update the Milkable interface in the solution repository to match the problem statement by removing the parameter from messageOnMilk, changing it to 'String messageOnMilk();', to ensure consistency and avoid misleading students about the intended design.

issues.description: The method for milking animals is described in the problem statement as a parameterless method (e.g., messageOnMilk()), but in the solution repository, it is implemented with a parameter (e.g., messageOnMilk(double volume)). This discrepancy could confuse students who base their implementation on the problem description, leading to mismatches in method signatures and hindering their ability to map requirements to the final solution.
issues.suggested_fix: Update the problem statement to specify the method signature as messageOnMilk(double volume) to align with the solution implementation, ensuring students implement the method with the correct parameter from the start.
